text: Richard John Long (4 May 1924 â€“ 28 July 2021) was an Australian politician. He was a member of the Liberal Party. He served as a member of the Victorian Legislative Council for Gippsland from 1973 to 1992. Long was born in Leongatha, Victoria. He served as a Royal Australian Air Force (RAAF) pilot during World War II. He died in 2021 at the age of 97. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Australian lawyers Category:Australian military people Category:Liberal Party of Australia politicians Category:Military personnel of World War II Category:Politicians from Victoria (Australia)
title: Dick Long
